title: Google\Cloud\Dlp\V2\RecordCondition\Condition
name: Condition
description:
The field type of value and field do not need to match to be considered equal, but not all comparisons are possible.

EQUAL_TO and NOT_EQUAL_TO attempt to compare even with incompatible types, but all other comparisons are invalid with incompatible types. A value of type:

  • string can be compared against all other types
  • boolean can only be compared against other booleans
  • integer can be compared against doubles or a string if the string value can be parsed as an integer.
  • double can be compared against integers or a string if the string can be parsed as a double.
  • Timestamp can be compared against strings in RFC 3339 date string format.
  • TimeOfDay can be compared against timestamps and strings in the format of 'HH:mm:ss'. If we fail to compare do to type mismatch, a warning will be given and the condition will evaluate to false.

Generated from protobuf message google.privacy.dlp.v2.RecordCondition.Condition

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message
